intro: Limonium aragonense, commonly known as the Aragon verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
